definition: lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
crane
cry of a crane or wild goose

sentences.english: But banks are so gun-shy now that no one would touch us.
sentences.chinese: 但現在銀行如此風聲鶴唳，沒有銀行搭理我們。

sentences.english: On top of that, many investors were gun-shy about another Dennis comeback.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯再次回到交易界，這讓很多投資者風聲鶴唳。

sentences.english: A guilty man apprehends danger in every sound.
sentences.chinese: 犯了罪的人對每一個聲音都感到風聲鶴唳。

sentences.english: It is also jittery about the "Occupy" movement that has been sweeping the West.
sentences.chinese: 席捲西方的“佔領”運動也使政府感到風聲鶴唳。

sentences.english: All of this has made us gun-shy about future supply predictions.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些已經使我們對未來供應預測變得風聲鶴唳。

definition: to be drowned (figurative and literal)
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
aggressive/truculent/overbearing
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
accomplice/accessory
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
trench/moat

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to shoot accidentally while polishing a gun/(fig.) a minor incident that sparks a war
snow line
lingering fear
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
